header.gameNote: SWAC MEN'S TOURNAMENT - SEMIFINALS AT GARLAND TX

article.headline: Alabama St. 73, Texas Southern 66
article.story: GARLAND, Texas -- Alabama State completed a day of upsets in the Southwestern Athletic Conference tournament semifinals on Friday, knocking off top-seeded Texas Southern 73-66. The fourth-seeded Hornets (16-17) advance to the championship game Saturday against sixth-seeded Grambling State, which defeated No. 2 Jackson State in the other semifinal Friday. Alabama State, which has won 10 of its last 11 games, had five players in double figures: Ivory White scored 17 points, Tremayne Moorer 14, Kenderek Washington 13, Jeff Middlebrooks 11 and Tramaine Butler 10. Harrison Smith had 24 points for Texas Southern (19-12), which trailed by as many as 19 points in the first half. The two teams combined to shoot 76 free throws -- Alabama State was 28 for 42 and Texas Southern 22 for 34.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
